title: Hmlet opens its biggest co-living property in Sydney's Inner West
text:
Co-living operator Hmlet is opening 82 rooms in Sydney's inner west suburb of St Peters in November – its biggest offering in Australia to date.

The four-storey warehouse conversion offers Hmlet members a choice of five different room types from across 38 brand new units.

Hmlet's latest and biggest co-living offering in Sydney's St Peters.

Co-living brings together high-quality rental rooms on short- to long-term leases under the boarding house provisions.

Co-living also allows tenants who are in between permanent accommodation to lease apartments and rooms on a flexible basis. Unlike private leases or Airbnb, co-living's main ethos lies in community living and operators like Hmlet have become more social operators than landlords, organising community events for each hub.

The St Peters Hmlet property in particular brings together two rising alternative housing concepts, co-living and build-to-rent.
description: Co-living operator Hmlet is opening 82 rooms in Sydney's inner west suburb of St Peters, its biggest Australian offering to date.
